sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच | ये शास्त्रविधिमुत्सृज्य यजन्ते श्रद्धयान्विताः | तेषां निष्ठा तु का कृष्ण सत्त्वमाहो रजस्तमः ||1||
transliteration:
arjuna uvācha
ye śhāstra-vidhim utsṛijya yajante śhraddhayānvitāḥ
teṣhāṁ niṣhṭhā tu kā kṛiṣhṇa sattvam āho rajas tamaḥ
translation: Arjuna said: O Krishna, what is the situation of those who worship with faith but disregard the injunctions of the scriptures? Is their faith in goodness, passion, or ignorance?

sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच | त्रिविधा भवति श्रद्धा देहिनां सा स्वभावजा | सात्त्विकी राजसी चैव तामसी चेति तां शृणु ||2||
transliteration:
śhrī-bhagavān uvācha
trividhā bhavati śhraddhā dehināṁ sā svabhāva-jā
sāttvikī rājasī chaiva tāmasī cheti tāṁ śhṛiṇu
translation: The Blessed Lord said: Faith is of three kinds, born of the nature of the embodied—sattvic, rajasic, and tamasic. Hear about them now.

sanskrit: सत्त्वानुरूपा सर्वस्य श्रद्धा भवति भारत | श्रद्धामयोऽयं पुरुषो यो यच्छ्रद्धः स एव सः ||3||
transliteration:
sattvānurūpā sarvasya śhraddhā bhavati bhārata
śhraddhā-mayo ’yaṁ puruṣho yo yac-chhraddhaḥ sa eva saḥ
translation: O Bharata, the faith of all beings conforms to their nature. A person is made of faith; whatever one’s faith is, that he becomes.

sanskrit: यजन्ते सात्त्विका देवान्यक्षरक्षांसि राजसाः | प्रेतान्भूतगणांश्चान्ये यजन्ते तामसा जनाः ||4||
transliteration:
yajante sāttvikā devān yakṣha-rakṣhāṁsi rājasāḥ
pretān bhūta-gaṇānśh chānye yajante tāmasā janāḥ
translation: Those in the mode of goodness worship the demigods; those in passion worship demons; and those in ignorance worship ghosts and spirits.

sanskrit: अशास्त्रविहितं घोरं तप्यन्ते ये तपो जनाः | दम्भाहंकारसंयुक्ताः कामरागबलान्विताः ||5||
transliteration:
aśhāstra-vihitaṁ ghoraṁ tapyante ye tapo janāḥ
dambha-ahaṅkāra-saṁyuktāḥ kāma-rāga-balānvitāḥ
translation: Those who perform severe austerities not enjoined by scripture, driven by hypocrisy and ego, impelled by desire and attachment...

sanskrit: कर्षयन्तः शरीरस्थं भूतग्राममचेतसः | मां चैवान्तःशरीरस्थं तान्विद्ध्यासुरनिश्चयान् ||6||
transliteration:
karṣhayantaḥ śharīra-sthaṁ bhūta-grāmam achetasaḥ
māṁ chaivāntaḥ-śharīra-sthaṁ tān viddhy āsura-niśhchayān
translation: ...they torture the bodily elements and Me who dwells within the body. Know them to be of demoniac resolve.

sanskrit: आहारस्त्वपि सर्वस्य त्रिविधो भवति प्रियः | यज्ञस्तपस्तथा दानं तेषां भेदमिमं शृणु ||7||
transliteration:
āhāras tv api sarvasya tri-vidho bhavati priyaḥ
yajñas tapas tathā dānaṁ teṣhāṁ bhedam imaṁ śhṛiṇu
translation: Even food, sacrifice, austerity, and charity are of three kinds. Hear now the distinctions among them.

sanskrit: आयुःसत्त्वबलारोग्यसुखप्रीतिविवर्धनाः | रस्याः स्निग्धाः स्थिरा हृद्या आहाराः सात्त्विकप्रियाः ||8||
transliteration:
āyuḥ-sattva-bala-ārogya-sukha-prīti-vivardhanāḥ
rasyāḥ snigdhāḥ sthirā hṛidyā āhārāḥ sāttvika-priyāḥ
translation: Foods that increase life, purity, strength, health, happiness, and satisfaction—juicy, fatty, wholesome, and pleasing—are dear to those in goodness.

sanskrit: कट्वम्ललवणात्युष्णतीक्ष्णरूक्षविदाहिनः | आहारा राजसस्येष्टा दुःखशोकामयप्रदाः ||9||
transliteration:
kaṭv-amla-lavaṇa-atyuṣhṇa-tīkṣhṇa-rūkṣha-vidāhinaḥ
āhārā rājasasyeṣṭā duḥkha-śhoka-āmaya-pradāḥ
translation: Foods that are bitter, sour, salty, excessively hot, pungent, dry, and burning are liked by those in passion. They cause pain, grief, and disease.

sanskrit: यातयामं गतरसं पूति पर्युषितं च यत् | उच्छिष्टमपि चामेध्यं भोजनं तामसप्रियम् ||10||
transliteration:
yāta-yāmaṁ gata-rasaṁ pūti paryuṣhitaṁ cha yat
uchchiṣhṭam api chāmedhyaṁ bhojanaṁ tāmasa-priyam
translation: Food that is stale, tasteless, putrid, decomposed, unclean, and impure is dear to those in the mode of ignorance.

sanskrit: अफलाकाङ्क्षिभिर्यज्ञो विधिदृष्टो य इज्यते | यष्टव्यमेवेति मनः समाधाय स सात्त्विकः ||11||
transliteration:
aphalākāṅkṣhibhir yajño vidhi-dṛiṣhṭo ya ijyate
yaṣhṭavyam eveti manaḥ samādhāya sa sāttvikaḥ
translation: Sacrifice that is offered according to scriptural directions, by those who do not seek reward and believe it is their duty—such sacrifice is in the mode of goodness.

sanskrit: अभिसन्धाय तु फलं दम्भार्थमपि चैव यत् | इज्यते भरतश्रेष्ठ तं यज्ञं विद्धि राजसम् ||12||
transliteration:
abhisandhāya tu phalaṁ dambhārtham api chaiva yat
ijyate bharata-śhreṣhṭha taṁ yajñaṁ viddhi rājasam
translation: But sacrifice performed for material gain or out of hypocrisy—know that to be in the mode of passion, O best of the Bharatas.

sanskrit: विधिहीनमसृष्टान्नं मन्त्रहीनमदक्षिणम् | श्रद्धाविरहितं यज्ञं तामसं परिचक्षते ||13||
transliteration:
vidhi-hīnam asṛiṣṭānnaṁ mantra-hīnam adakṣiṇam
śhraddhā-virahitaṁ yajñaṁ tāmasaṁ parichakṣhate
translation: Sacrifice that is not in accordance with scriptural rules, where no food is distributed, no mantras are chanted, and no priests are paid, and which is done without faith—is said to be in the mode of ignorance.

sanskrit: देवद्विजगुरुप्राज्ञपूजनं शौचमार्जवम् | ब्रह्मचर्यमहिंसा च शारीरं तप उच्यते ||14||
transliteration:
deva-dvija-guru-prājña-pūjanaṁ śhaucham ārjavam
brahmacharyam ahiṁsā cha śhārīraṁ tapa uchyate
translation: Worship of the gods, the twice-born, teachers, and the wise; purity, honesty, celibacy, and nonviolence—these are austerities of the body.

sanskrit: अनुद्वेगकरं वाक्यं सत्यं प्रियहितं च यत् | स्वाध्यायाभ्यसनं चैव वाङ्मयं तप उच्यते ||15||
transliteration:
anudvega-karaṁ vākyaṁ satyaṁ priya-hitaṁ cha yat
svādhyāyābhyasanaṁ chaiva vāṅ-mayaṁ tapa uchyate
translation: Speech that does not cause distress, is truthful, pleasing, and beneficial, and regular recitation of the scriptures—this is austerity of speech.

sanskrit: मनःप्रसादः सौम्यत्वं मौनमात्मविनिग्रहः | भावसंशुद्धिरित्येतत्तपो मानसमुच्यते ||16||
transliteration:
manaḥ-prasādaḥ saumyatvaṁ maunam ātma-vinigrahaḥ
bhāva-sanśhuddhir ity etat tapo mānasam uchyate
translation: Serenity of mind, gentleness, silence, self-restraint, and purity of thought—these are austerities of the mind.

sanskrit: श्रद्धया परया तप्तं तपस्तत्त्रिविधं नरैः | अफलाकाङ्क्षिभिर्युक्तैः सात्त्विकं परिचक्षते ||17||
transliteration:
śhraddhayā parayā taptaṁ tapas tat tri-vidhaṁ naraiḥ
aphalākāṅkṣhibhir yuktaiḥ sāttvikaṁ parichakṣhate
translation: This threefold austerity, practiced with supreme faith by those who seek no reward, is said to be in the mode of goodness.

sanskrit: सत्कारमानपूजार्थं तपो दम्भेन चैव यत् | क्रियते तदिह प्रोक्तं राजसं चलमध्रुवम् ||18||
transliteration:
satkāra-māna-pūjārthaṁ tapo dambhena chaiva yat
kriyate tad iha proktaṁ rājasaṁ chalam adhruvam
translation: Austerity performed with hypocrisy for the sake of honor, respect, and worship is said to be in the mode of passion. It is unstable and impermanent.

sanskrit: मूढग्राहेणात्मनो यत्पीडया क्रियते तपः | परस्योत्सादनार्थं वा तत्तामसमुदाहृतम् ||19||
transliteration:
mūḍha-grāheṇātmano yat pīḍayā kriyate tapaḥ
parasyotsādana-arthaṁ vā tat tāmasam udāhṛitam
translation: Austerity performed with foolish stubbornness, causing pain to oneself or to others, is said to be in the mode of ignorance.

sanskrit: दातव्यमिति यद्दानं दीयतेऽनुपकारिणे | देशे काले च पात्रे च तद्दानं सात्त्विकं स्मृतम् ||20||
transliteration:
dātavyam iti yad dānaṁ dīyate ’nupakāriṇe
deśhe kāle cha pātre cha tad dānaṁ sāttvikaṁ smṛitam
translation: Charity given as a duty, to a worthy person, at the proper time and place, without expectation of return, is considered to be in the mode of goodness.

sanskrit: यत्तु प्रत्युपकारार्थं फलमुद्दिश्य वा पुनः | दीयते च परिक्लिष्टं तद्दानं राजसं स्मृतम् ||21||
transliteration:
yat tu pratyupakārārthaṁ phalam uddiśhya vā punaḥ
dīyate cha parikliṣhṭaṁ tad dānaṁ rājasaṁ smṛitam
translation: Charity given with the expectation of return, or for some result, or grudgingly, is said to be in the mode of passion.

sanskrit: अदेशकाले यद्दानमपात्रेभ्यश्च दीयते | असत्कृतमवज्ञातं तत्तामसमुदाहृतम् ||22||
transliteration:
adeśa-kāle yad dānam apātrebhyaśh cha dīyate
asat-kṛitam avajñātaṁ tat tāmasam udāhṛitam
translation: Charity given at the wrong place or time, to unworthy persons, without respect or with contempt, is said to be in the mode of ignorance.

sanskrit: ॐ तत्सदिति निर्देशो ब्रह्मणस्त्रिविधः स्मृतः | ब्राह्मणास्तेन वेदाश्च यज्ञाश्च विहिताः पुरा ||23||
transliteration:
oṁ tat sad iti nirdeśho brahmaṇas tri-vidhaḥ smṛitaḥ
brāhmaṇās tena vedāśh cha yajñāśh cha vihitāḥ purā
translation: The words 'Om Tat Sat' are used to indicate the Supreme Brahman. From these were created the Brahmins, the Vedas, and the sacrifices in ancient times.

sanskrit: तस्मादोमित्युदाहृत्य यज्ञदानतपःक्रियाः | प्रवर्तन्ते विधानोक्ताः सततं ब्रह्मवादिनाम् ||24||
transliteration:
tasmād om ity udāhṛitya yajña-dāna-tapaḥ-kriyāḥ
pravartante vidhānoktāḥ satataṁ brahma-vādinām
translation: Therefore, acts of sacrifice, charity, and austerity prescribed by the scriptures are always begun with the utterance of 'Om' by those who understand the Absolute Truth.

sanskrit: तदित्यनभिसन्धाय फलं यज्ञतपःक्रियाः | दानक्रियाश्च विविधाः क्रियन्ते मोक्षकाङ्क्षिभिः ||25||
transliteration:
tat ity anabhisandhāya phalaṁ yajña-tapaḥ-kriyāḥ
dāna-kriyāśh cha vividhāḥ kriyante mokṣha-kāṅkṣhibhiḥ
translation: With the word 'Tat', acts of sacrifice, austerity, and charity are performed without desire for reward by those seeking liberation.

sanskrit: सद्भावे साधुभावे च सदित्येतत्प्रयुज्यते | प्रशस्ते कर्मणि तथा सच्छब्दः पार्थ युज्यते ||26||
transliteration:
sad-bhāve sādhu-bhāve cha sad ity etat prayujyate
praśhaste karmaṇi tathā sach-chhabdaḥ pārtha yujyate
translation: The word 'Sat' is used to denote reality and goodness. It is also used to describe auspicious actions, O Partha.

sanskrit: यज्ञे तपसि दाने च स्थितिः सदिति चोच्यते | कर्म चैव तदर्थीयं सदित्येवाभिधीयते ||27||
transliteration:
yajñe tapasi dāne cha sthitiḥ sad iti chochyate
karma chaiva tad-arthīyaṁ sad ity evābhidhīyate
translation: Steadfastness in sacrifice, austerity, and charity is also called 'Sat'. So too is any action performed for the sake of the Supreme.

sanskrit: अश्रद्धया हुतं दत्तं तपस्तप्तं कृतं च यत् | असदित्युच्यते पार्थ न च तत्प्रेत्य नो इह ||28||
transliteration:
aśhraddhayā hutaṁ dattaṁ tapas taptaṁ kṛitaṁ cha yat
asad ity uchyate pārtha na cha tat pretya no iha
translation: O Partha, whatever is offered in sacrifice, given in charity, or performed as austerity without faith is called 'Asat'. It is useless both in this life and the next.
